channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The NSW-Victoria border has shut, with residents from either state needing a permit to cross into NSW.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria, Greater Melbourne prepare for lockdown as state braces for COVID-19 spike; NSW border closed indefinitely

item.dc:creator: Sherryn Groch
item.description: Why is Victoria locking back down? What the rules in the rest of the country? And where are we on the roadmap to recovery?
item.title: Victoria locks down while Australia opens: what are the COVID-19 rules now?

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: One of Virgin Australia's largest bondholders is pushing to unseal the secret details of a deal to sell the bankrupt airline to private equity firm Bain Capital.
item.title: Virgin Australia bondholder launches court action to unveil secret Bain deal

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Victory, City and Western failed to get out of the state on Tuesday for the second night in a row and will stay in Victoria as the FFA tries again to get them exemptions to cross the border.
item.title: Clubs angry but FFA defends second failed attempt to get teams out of Victoria

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The Australian sharemarket is expected to slump at the open of trade as coronavirus lockdowns and second-surge fears sap investor confidence.
item.title: ASX to fall after virus surge halts Wall St rally

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Coles and Woolworths announced product limits for Victorian stores on Wednesday, after shoppers again stripped shelves overnight.
item.title: Supermarkets reinstate product limits after shoppers strip shelves

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Motorists face long waits to get into NSW as police enforce the first border closure in a century between Australia's two most populous states.
item.title: Long queues into NSW as border closure enforced

item.description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo says the US will restrict visas for some Chinese officials because of human rights abuses in Tibet.
item.title: US will restrict visas for Chinese officials over Tibet, Pompeo says

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: There is a risk that China will be the only nation with essential materials needed for defence and renewables technology over the coming years as they increase their market dominance of rare earths.
item.title: Alarm bells sound as China strengthens its chokehold on Australia's high-tech metals

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 8, 2020

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: After spending months working to get the virus out of the state, authorities are now seeing a surge in Australian residents, both overseas and interstate, trying to get into WA’s COVID “safe-haven”.
item.title: WA's COVID-free status sees surge in overseas and interstate Australians trying to get into 'virus-free haven'

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Twenty-Test Wallaby Morgan Turinui has shared some strong views regarding the performance of Melbourne Rebels under coach Dave Wessels.
item.title: 'Dave Wessels is not the answer': Former Wallaby believes time is up for Rebels coach

item.description: Sweden has shown the world to examine what happens in a pandemic when a government allows life to carry on largely unhindered. And it's economy is paying the price.
item.title: 'Self-inflicted wound': Sweden has become the world’s pandemic cautionary tale

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: Last week the Yi-Martuwarra Ngurrara native title group voiced disappointment that its consortium's $25 million bid had been knocked back because it couldn't compete with bids that have reached at least $30 million.
item.title: Ben Wyatt's hands tied over million-dollar battle for Kimberley cattle station

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: A man has been charged with a string of offences over the crash including driving without a licence.
item.title: Sunshine Coast father killed on footpath by allegedly stolen car

item.description: FBI Director Christopher Wray claims China is running a program called Fox Hunt aimed at silencing vocal critics of Beijing's political, human rights policies.
item.title: FBI chief claims China using 'shocking' tactics to pressure critics

item.description: Jamie Vardy pounces to score a crucial late equaliser, Chelsea go third with derby win and Danny Welbeck scores first goal in almost two years. It was worth the wait.
item.title: Vardy's late strike rescues Leicester, Welbeck stunner pulls Watford closer to safety

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: Losses in store for ASX as Wall Street's five-day rally ends

item.dc:creator: Peter Wells
item.description: Josie and the Podcats discusses the cultural impact of a teen comedy that bombed at the box office.
item.title: Pussycats podcast dives deep on a cult classic flop

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: Bon Iver will be joined by Patti Smith, Jimmy Barnes, The Teskey Brothers, The Black Sorrows and many more.
item.title: Bluesfest forges ahead with 2021 festival plans, with Bon Iver set to headline

item.description: Mark Zuckerberg failed to win over critics after meeting with civil rights groups in an attempt to mollify them about how Facebook treats hate speech.
item.title: Facebook 'turned to spin' in meeting with organisers of ad boycott

item.description: investors took profits a day after the S&P 500 logged its longest streak of gains this year and as new US coronavirus cases rose further.
item.title: ASX set to fall as Wall Street's five-day rally ends

item.description: Trump administration has sent a letter to the United Nations withdrawing the US from the World Health Organisation over its handling of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: US officially gives notice of plans to leave World Health Organisation

item.description: The analysis warns that the biggest losses would be felt next season, even if it is played in full and in front of crowds.
item.title: Europe's top-flight clubs face $6.46b in lost revenue due to COVID-19

item.description: Ben Simmons' Philadelphia teammate Joel Embiid wants to play, but says he's no fan of the bubble environment the NBA will operate.
item.title: NBA superstar 'doesn't trust' fellow players to remain in bubble

item.description: Bayer's plan for moving on from its Roundup legal woes hit a snag barely two weeks after it announced a nearly $US11 billion settlement of claims the popular weedkiller causes cancer
item.title: Roundup $US11b cancer settlement hits a hurdle over Bayer's plan for future claims

item.description: The number of global job losses has been 10 times greater than the hit inflicted during the first months of 2008 global financial crisis, and a return to pre-pandemic levels is years away, warns the OECD.
item.title: Jobs wipeout: The pandemic’s economic damage is growing

item.description: A New York regulator fined the bank for allowing disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein to make payments to Russian models and withdraw suspicious amounts of cash.
item.title: Deutsche Bank hit with $US150 million fine over links to Jeffrey Epstein

item.description: President Donald Trump's niece will publish a tell-all family memoir describing how a decades-long history of darkness, dysfunction and brutality turned her uncle into a reckless leader.
item.title: Mary Trump’s book accuses the President of embracing 'cheating as a way of life'

item.description: Bolsonaro has repeatedly played down the impact of the virus, even as Brazil has suffered one of the world's worst outbreaks.
item.title: Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro tests positive for COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Giant $100m device to detect supernovas, neutron stars and birth of black holes should be built in Australia, report delivered to federal government says.
item.title: Funding NEMO: Building $100m black hole detector 'not pie in the sky'

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: "You keep on hearing people say things like: 'this has been the worst day I’ve ever had'. And then it keeps on going… and it gets progressively worse," said a local tourism manager.
item.title: 'Six months of lost trade': South Coast businesses to suffer from border closure

item.dc:creator: Ella Archibald-Binge
item.description: The NSW government will appoint an independent Aboriginal children's guardian as part of several child protection reforms.
item.title: 'Game-changing': Aboriginal guardian to tackle child protection

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Having got his life in order off the field, Reynolds is rediscovering his best form on it - but doesn't want to think about potentially ending the career of club legend Benji Marshall.
item.title: 'It’s been a rocky road': Reynolds keen to stamp mark on Tigers after resurgence

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Banks will allow people who paused their mortgage payments as an emergency measure to extend their loan deferral by up to four months if needed.
item.title: Banks throw lifeline to pandemic-hit borrowers to stop financial 'cliff'

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Closing the borders between our two most populous states will probably have nasty economic side effects. But it is a price worth paying.
item.title: State border closure worth the economic pain

item.description: Criticisms of the Sydney Film Festival following the Mukbang controversy are hurtful and alarming.
item.title: Something dangerously askew with the way we're talking about race and the arts

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, July 8

item.description: Last week,President Macron announced a $24 billion program in response to a Citizens’ Assembly on climate change.
item.title: Can we follow the French out of gridlock on climate?

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Office tenants are being offered higher incentives for leases in an effort to get them back to the CBD.
item.title: Office lease lures surge to entice tenants

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Under normal circumstances, executives offloading stock is a red flag for investors who would wonder why they should pump money into a stock which insiders are selling.
item.title: Sell now, worry later: Afterpay founders cash in on 600% bounce

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: Over the next 72 hours, 650 police officers and at least 350 Australia Defence Force personnel will take their post at 55 border crossings, as authorities scramble to stem the growing Victorian outbreak of COVID-19.
item.title: Massive operation as permit plan put into place at border

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: More than a quarter of Australians feel their relationships have improved during COVID-19, in a heartening sign that lockdown has brought many families closer.
item.title: 'Really special': More Australians say relationships have improved

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Australia’s college for obstetricians and gynaecologists will move to new headquarters near St Kilda Road after spending more than $19 million for new offices.
item.title: College snaps up 7-level office in $19m deal

item.description: After eating at some of Sydney swankiest restaurants, I have come to the conclusion that ordering off the kids' menu is where it's at.
item.title: Why can't I eat at the kids' table?

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Male lawyers say it is time for them to take an active role in combatting sexual harassment.
item.title: 'It's 2020, not 1970': Men in law call time on sexual harassment

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Lendlease has been downgraded to neutral by property analysts because of concerns about the ongoing impact of the global pandemic on the construction and development sectors.
item.title: Lendlease downgraded, Mirvac upgraded as COVID divides property sector

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Dexus has continued with its plan to increase exposure to the booming logistics sector with the acquisitions of two large sites in Sydney and Melbourne.
item.title: Dexus expands logistics footprint with $173.5m deal

item.description: If protecting public health is the goal, residents of the locked-down, densely-populated Melbourne towers should be rehoused rather than confined.
item.title: Locked-down towers should be evacuated to protect all
